I agree that it would be helpful to have an offcial browsable location for =
the Javadoc for each release. However, this is not available at the moment.=
 

To help you out there are two resources:

1. There is an officially publ=
ished Javadoc JAR in the Maven repo which you can download and extract (or =
attach to the real JAR in your IDE of choice): http://search.maven.org/remo=
tecontent?filepath=3Djunit/junit/4.11/junit-4.11-javadoc.jar

2. The very l=
atest bleeding-edge snapshot Javadoc can be accessed on our Jenkins: https:=
//junit.ci.cloudbees.com/job/JUnit/javadoc/

Hope this helps!

Cheers, Marc=
